member.name: T:TingenWebService.Configuration.RuntimeConfig
member.remarks: For more information about the Tingen Web Service, please see the file.

member.name: M:TingenWebService.Configuration.RuntimeConfig.Load(TingenWebService.Properties.Settings,System.String)
member.summary: Loads the runtime configuration from the Web.config file.

remarks.para:
Since the Tingen Web Service is not directly referenced by Outpost31, the settings are read into a dictionary instead of a strongly-typed object.
When a new setting is added to the Web.config file, it must also be added to the RuntimeConfig class.
IMPORTANT! Care must be taken to ensure the keys in Web.config match the keys expected by the code.
Please note: Since the logging functionality isn't setup yet, use .

member.param: The current version of the Tingen Web Service.
member.returns: A dictionary with the runtime configuration settings.

member.name: T:TingenWebService.ProjectInfo
member.summary: Provides additional information about the Tingen Web Service.

remarks.para:
About the Tingen Web Service
Netsmart's Avatar™ is a behavioral health EHR that offers a recovery-focused suite of solutions that leverage real-time analytics and clinical decision support to drive value-based care.
While Avatar™ is a robust platform, it isn't perfect. The good news is that you can extend myAvatar™ functionality via Netsmart's Avatar™ Web Services, and/or custom web services that are written by other Avatar™ users.
Tingen is one such custom web service which includes various tools and utilities for Avatar™ that aren't included in the official release, and provides a solid foundation for building additional functionality quickly and efficiently.

para.note:
Tingen project repositories:
Tingen Web Service
Outpost32

Tingen project documentation:
Tingen Documentation Project
Tingen Web Service Manual
Development Documentation

member.name: M:TingenWebService.TingenWebService.RunScript(ScriptLinkStandard.Objects.OptionObject2015,System.String)
member.summary: Determines what the Tingen Web Service will do.

remarks.note:
The values stored in Web.config, but since Outpost31 doesn't reference the TingenWebService project, the values are converted into a dictionary instead of a strongly-typed object. This makes it easier to pass to .
Care must be taken to ensure the keys in Web.config match the keys expected by the code.

Do not change the names of the following parameters:
origOptObj
origScriptParam
For some reason, changing these names causes the web service to fail.

member.param: The original that is sent from Avatar.
member.returns: An representing the result of the .
